alert.note: Alert for Johnson (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 26 at 4:30PM MDT until June 26 at 7:15PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: The National Weather Service in Riverton has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... Central Johnson County in north central Wyoming... * Until 715 PM MDT. * At 430 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Estimated rainfall rates of 1 to 2"/hr occurring with this storm. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... mainly rural areas of Central Johnson County This includes the following highways... Interstate 25 between mile markers 285 and 292. This includes the following streams and drainages... Bilderback Creek, Crazy Woman Creek, Little North Fork Crazy Woman Creek, North Fork Crazy Woman Creek, Kingsbury Ridge Draw, Wallows Draw, Bull Creek, South Fork Bull Creek, Billy Creek, Muddy Creek, Grosset Canyon, Wallows Creek, Bullwacker Creek, Eder Draw and Kelly Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
